      • getInitialPositions

        public java.lang.String getInitialPositions()
        Returns a comma or space separated list like: x1,y1,heading1, x2,y2,heading2, which are the coordinates and heading of robot #1 and #2. So "(0,0,180), (50,80,270)" means that robot #1 has position (0,0) and heading 180, and robot #2 has position (50,80) and heading 270. Override this method to explicitly specify the initial positions for your test cases. Defaults to null, which means that the initial positions are determined randomly. Since battles are deterministic by default, the initial positions are randomly chosen but will always be the same each time you run the test case.
        Overrides:
        getInitialPositions in class robocode.control.testing.RobotTestBed
        Returns:
        The list of initial positions.

      • isDeterministic

        public boolean isDeterministic()
        Returns true if the battle should be deterministic and thus robots will always start in the same position each time. Override to return false to support random initialization.
        Overrides:
        isDeterministic in class robocode.control.testing.RobotTestBed
        Returns:
        True if the battle will be deterministic.

      • getExpectedErrors

        protected int getExpectedErrors()
        Specifies how many errors you expect this battle to generate. Defaults to 0. Override this method to change the number of expected errors.
        Overrides:
        getExpectedErrors in class robocode.control.testing.RobotTestBed
        Returns:
        The expected number of errors.

      • runSetup

        protected void runSetup()
        Invoked before the test battle begins. Default behavior is to do nothing. Override this method in your test case to add behavior before the battle starts.
